intro: Carex × josephi-schmittii, commonly known as the Schmitt's sedge, is a hybrid plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces cylindrical spikes of pale to brownish flowers. This plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water garden landscapes.
